Peripheral.Name: Embedded Flash
Peripheral.Description: The Flash memory interface manages CPU AHB I-Code and D-Code accesses to the Flash memory. It implements the erase and program Flash memory operations and the read and write protection mechanisms

Peripheral.Name: Data EEPROM
Peripheral.Description: The Data EEPROM memory block. It contains user data.

Peripheral.Name: OTP
Peripheral.Description: The Data OTP memory block. It contains the one time programmable bits.

Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: Level 0, no protection
Level 1, read protection of memories
Level 2, chip protection

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: These bits contain the VDD supply level threshold that activates/releases the reset.

Values.Val: BOR Level 0, reset level threshold is around 1.7 V
BOR Level 1, reset level threshold is around 2.0 V
BOR Level 2, reset level threshold is around 2.2 V
BOR Level 3, reset level threshold is around 2.5 V
BOR Level 4, reset level threshold is around 2.8 V
Reset generated when entering Stop mode
No reset generated when entering Stop mode
Reset generated when entering Standby mode
No reset generated when entering Standby mode

Bit.Name: SRAM1_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM1 erase upon system reset

Values.Val: SRAM1 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM1 not erased when a system reset occurs
Hardware independent watchdog
Software independent watchdog
Freeze IWDG counter in stop mode
IWDG counter active in stop mode
Freeze IWDG counter in standby mode
IWDG counter active in standby mode
Hardware window watchdog
Software window watchdog
Bank 1 and bank 2 address are not swapped
Bank 1 and bank 2 address are swapped

Bit.Name: SRAM2_PE
Bit.Description: SRAM2 parity check enable

Values.Val: SRAM2 PE check enabled
SRAM2 PE check disabled

Bit.Name: SRAM2_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM2 Erase when system reset

Values.Val: SRAM2 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM2 is not erased when a system reset occurs

Bit.Name: nSWBOOT0
Bit.Description: Software BOOT0

Values.Val: BOOT0 taken from the option bit nBOOT0
BOOT0 taken from PH3/BOOT0 pin

Bit.Name: nBOOT0
Bit.Description: nBOOT0 option bit

Values.Val: nBOOT0 = 0
nBOOT0 = 1

Bit.Name: IO_VDD_HSLV
Bit.Description: High-speed IO at low VDD voltage configuration

Values.Val: High-speed IO at low VDD voltage disabled
High-speed IO at low VDD voltage enabling in GPIO peripheral allowed

Bit.Name: IO_VDDIO2_HSLV
Bit.Description: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage configuration

Values.Val: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage disabled
High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage enabling in GPIO peripheral allowed

Bit.Name: TZEN
Bit.Description: Global TrustZone security enable

Values.Val: Global TrustZone security disabled
Global TrustZone security enabled

Bit.Name: NSBOOTADD0
Bit.Description: Non-secure Boot base address 0

Bit.Name: NSBOOTADD1
Bit.Description: Non-secure Boot base address 1

Bit.Name: WRP1A_PSTRT
Bit.Description: WPR first area "A" start page

Bit.Name: WRP1A_PEND
Bit.Description: WPR first area "A" end page

Bit.Name: UNLOCK_1A
Bit.Description: WPR first area A unlock

Values.Val: WRPA start and end pages locked
WRPA start and end pages unlocked

Bit.Name: WRP1B_PSTRT
Bit.Description: WPR second area "B" start page

Bit.Name: WRP1B_PEND
Bit.Description: WPR second area "B" end page

Bit.Name: UNLOCK_1B
Bit.Description: WPR second area B unlock

Values.Val: WRPB start and end pages locked
WRPB start and end pages unlocked

Bit.Name: WRP2A_PSTRT
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area "A" start page

Bit.Name: WRP2A_PEND
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area "A" end page

Bit.Name: UNLOCK_2A
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area A unlock

Values.Val: WRP2A start and end pages locked
WRP2A start and end pages unlocked

Bit.Name: WRP2B_PSTRT
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area "B" start page

Bit.Name: WRP2B_PEND
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area "B" end page

Bit.Name: UNLOCK_2B
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area B unlock

Values.Val: WRP2B start and end pages locked
WRP2B start and end pages unlocked

Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: Level 0, no protection
Level 0.5, read protection not active, only non-secure debug access is possible. Only available when TrustZone is active (TZEN=1)
Level 1, read protection of memories
Level 2, chip protection

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: These bits contain the VDD supply level threshold that activates/releases the reset.

Values.Val: BOR Level 0, reset level threshold is around 1.7 V
BOR Level 1, reset level threshold is around 2.0 V
BOR Level 2, reset level threshold is around 2.2 V
BOR Level 3, reset level threshold is around 2.5 V
BOR Level 4, reset level threshold is around 2.8 V
Reset generated when entering Stop mode
No reset generated when entering Stop mode
Reset generated when entering Standby mode
No reset generated when entering Standby mode

Bit.Name: SRAM1_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM1 erase upon system reset

Values.Val: SRAM1 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM1 not erased when a system reset occurs
Hardware independent watchdog
Software independent watchdog
Freeze IWDG counter in stop mode
IWDG counter active in stop mode
Freeze IWDG counter in standby mode
IWDG counter active in standby mode
Hardware window watchdog
Software window watchdog
Bank 1 and bank 2 address are not swapped
Bank 1 and bank 2 address are swapped

Bit.Name: SRAM2_PE
Bit.Description: SRAM2 parity check enable

Values.Val: SRAM2 parity check enable
SRAM2 parity check disable

Bit.Name: SRAM2_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM2 Erase when system reset

Values.Val: SRAM2 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM2 is not erased when a system reset occurs

Bit.Name: nSWBOOT0

Values.Val: BOOT0 taken from the option bit nBOOT0
BOOT0 taken from PH3/BOOT0 pin

Bit.Name: nBOOT0

nBOOT0 = 1

Bit.Name: IO_VDDIO2_HSLV
Bit.Description: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage configuration

High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage enabling in GPIO peripheral allowed

Bit.Name: TZEN
Bit.Description: Global TrustZone security enable

Values.Val: Global TrustZone security disabled
Global TrustZone security enabled

Bit.Name: NSBOOTADD0
Bit.Description: Non-secure Boot base address 0

Bit.Name: NSBOOTADD1
Bit.Description: Non-secure Boot base address 1

Bit.Name: SECBOOTADD0
Bit.Description: Secure boot base address 0

Bit.Name: BOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: The boot is always forced to base address value programmed in SECBOOTADD0

Values.Val: Boot based on the pad/option bit configuration
Boot forced from base address memory

Bit.Name: SECWM1_PSTRT
Bit.Description: Start page of secure area

Bit.Name: SECWM1_PEND
Bit.Description: End page of first secure area

Bit.Name: HDP1_PEND
Bit.Description: End page of secure hide protection area

Bit.Name: HDP1EN
Bit.Description: Secure Hide protection first area enable

Values.Val: No secHDP area
HDP first area is enabled

Bit.Description: Hide protection second area enable

Values.Val: No HDP area 2
HDP second area is enabled

Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: Level 0, no protection
Level 1, read protection of memories
Level 2, chip protection

Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: Level 0, no protection
Level 0.5, read protection not active, only non-secure debug access is possible. Only available when TrustZone is active (TZEN=1)
Level 1, read protection of memories
Level 2, chip protection

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: These bits contain the supply level threshold that activates/releases the reset. They can be written to program a new BOR level value into Flash memory

Values.Val: BOR Level 0, reset level threshold is around 1.7 V
BOR Level 1, reset level threshold is around 2.0 V
BOR Level 2, reset level threshold is around 2.2 V
BOR Level 3, reset level threshold is around 2.5 V
BOR Level 4, reset level threshold is around 2.8 V
Reset generated when entering Stop mode
No reset generated when entering Stop mode
Reset generated when entering Standby mode
No reset generated when entering Standby mode

Bit.Name: SRAM1_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM1 erase upon system reset

Values.Val: SRAM1 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM1 not erased when a system reset occurs
Hardware independent watchdog
Software independent watchdog
Freeze IWDG counter in stop mode
IWDG counter active in stop mode
Freeze IWDG counter in standby mode
IWDG counter active in standby mode
Hardware window watchdog
Software window watchdog
Bank 1 and bank 2 address are not swapped
Bank 1 and bank 2 address are swapped

Bit.Name: SRAM2_PE
Bit.Description: SRAM2 parity check enable

Values.Val: SRAM2 parity check enable
SRAM2 parity check disable

Bit.Name: SRAM2_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM2 Erase when system reset

Values.Val: SRAM2 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM2 is not erased when a system reset occurs

BOOT0 taken from PH3/BOOT0 pin

Bit.Name: nBOOT0
Bit.Description: nBOOT0 option bit

Values.Val: nBOOT0 = 0
nBOOT0 = 1

High-speed IO at low VDD voltage enabling in GPIO peripheral allowed
